Bush as presiding over a national security process that was marked by incoherent decision-making and policy drift, most damagingly on the war in Iraq." Donald Rumsfeld remains largely unapologetic about his overall handling of the Iraq conflict and concludes that the war has been worth the costs. Had the government of Saddam Hussein remained in power, he says, the Middle East would be` far more perilous than it is today'.
